info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 20 at 7:21PM MDT until June 21 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM MDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN YUMA COUNTY... At 720 PM MDT, a severe storm was located 7 miles northeast of Cope, or 25 miles south of Yuma, and is nearly stationary. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...at 6:57pm MDT, an Off-Duty NWS Employee reported quarter sized hail 4 SW of Abarr. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Yuma County. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
